doc.after: The most important use of water in agriculture is for irrigation, which is a key component to produce enough food. Irrigation takes up to 90% of water withdrawn in some developing countries[59] and significant proportions in more economically developed countries (United States, 30% of freshwater usage is for irrigation).[60]
